questions.clue: This American swimmer became the most decorated Olympian of all time with 28 total medals.
Famous for her 'Nadia's Theme,' this gymnast scored the first perfect 10 in Olympic history at the 1976 Montreal Games.
This track and field star, who won 9 gold medals between 1984 and 1996, was also known for his activism and philanthropy.
This legendary basketball player and 'Dream Team' member won Olympic gold in 1992 and later became part-owner of the Los Angeles Dodgers.
This multi-sport athlete was both an Olympic gold medalist in decathlon and an NFL player, and his Native American heritage was a source of pride and controversy.

categories.name: Literary Landscapes: Settings in Classic Novels

questions.clue: This moor features as the home landscape of Cathy and Heathcliff in Emily Brontë's famous novel.
Jay Gatsby's mansion is located in this fictional Long Island village, representing wealth in 'The Great Gatsby.'
In this Dickens novel, the protagonist Pip grows up in the marshes of Kent before moving to London.
This is the name of the secluded plantation home in Zora Neale Hurston's 'Their Eyes Were Watching God,' where Janie seeks independence.
In this Melville work, the Pequod sails from this Massachusetts island known for its whaling history, leading to encounters with the white whale.

categories.name: Uncommon Instruments: Sounds from Around the World

questions.clue: This Australian wind instrument, traditionally made from eucalyptus, is often used to create a drone effect.
Often played in Andean music, this panpipe instrument consists of multiple tubes of varying lengths.
Known for its use in Tuvan throat singing, this string instrument is played with a bow and has horsehead carvings.
Originating from Norway, this string instrument resembles a regular violin but with additional resonating strings.
An ancient Chinese zither, this instrument has captivated many with its distinctive silk strings and rich history associated with the philosopher Confucius.

categories.name: Architectural Marvels: Skyscrapers of the 21st Century

questions.clue: This iconic skyscraper in Dubai, opened in 2010, holds the title of the world's tallest building.
The Ping An Finance Centre, completed in 2017 in this Chinese city, is the tallest building in its country.
Standing in the Malaysian capital, this skyscraper surpassed the Petronas Towers as the tallest building in Southeast Asia in 2022.
Home to the world's highest tennis court, the Burj Al Arab is in this city, also known for the luxurious Dubai Tennis Championships.
Linked to the tallest residential building in New York City, the 432 Park Avenue, is this architect known for his work with precision and simplicity.

categories.name: Planetary Wonders: Mysteries of Our Solar System

questions.clue: This planet, famous for its rings, is the second-largest in our solar system and shares its name with the Roman god of agriculture.
Sporting a giant storm akin to a massive hurricane, this 'Great Red Spot' is found on the largest planet in our solar system.
Like a gymnast stretching its rings, this planet orbits our Sun tilted on its side, resulting in extreme seasons.
Our closest planetary neighbor, it's known for its thick, toxic atmosphere and the hottest surface temperatures, akin to being too close to a sports stadium firework display.
Similar to a long-distance runner's endurance, this dwarf planet takes about 248 Earth years to complete one orbit around the Sun.

final.clue: This nation, which competed for the first time under its current name in the 1992 Summer Olympics, has more gold medals in the Winter Olympics than in the Summer Olympics.
